channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4064] Get Well, Kevin Rose! Sincerely, The Old Spice Man (Video)
item.description: Dearest Kevin,I know you've been under the weather lately and I made a little video to help cheer you up. Stay well, my brainiac friend!Sincerestly,The Old Spice Man

item.title: [+3289] Jewel Sings Her Own Songs at Karaoke in Disguise
item.description: Jewel, disguised as a mild mannered businesswoman, drops by a local karaoke bar and performs some of her classic songs to a completely dumbfounded audience.

item.title: [+2815] Anthony Bourdain gets owned by a 10 year old girl
[+1433] Expendables Trailer Asks Men To Fight Back Against Twilight
item.description: On August 13th it's time for all men to stand up with Stallone and fight back against the sap!

item.title: [+1396] Clever & Creative Advertising Billboard (pic)
[+1349] Ah, good old days of piracy... (pic)
[+1254] Mel Gibson Goes Apeshit in Latest Recording . . . Again
item.description: Mel Gibson, under investigation for domestic violence, admits to hitting Oksana Grigorieva and TWICE threatens to kill her in an explosive new audio tape.

item.title: [+1155] Large Hadron Collider rival Tevatron 'has found Higgs boson'
item.description: Rumours are emerging from the rival to the Large Hadron Collider that the Higgs boson, or so-called "God particle", has been found.

item.title: [+1088] The Disappearing Intellectual
item.description: We live at a time that might be appropriately called the age of the disappearing intellectual, a disappearance that marks with disgrace a particularly dangerous period in American history.

item.title: [+931] A Holocaust Survivor Dances To "I Will Survive" At Auschwitz
item.description: The most heartwarming Holocaust memorial ever displayed

item.title: [+913] What can I say? (PIC)
[+834] I Find My New Helmet
[+826] George Steinbrenner Dies of Massive Heart Attack
item.description: Yankees owner George Steinbrenner died this morning after suffering a massive heart attack, the Associated Press reports.

item.title: [+608] Academic Study Says Violent Video Games Reduces Stress
item.description: Texas A&M International University recently conducted a study in which volunteers were subjected to stress, with some subjects being allowed to play video games afterward. According to the results, the game-playing group reported less stress and depression afterward.

item.title: [+603] At 18, she's already on her third business
item.description: Chances are, when you were 18, you were probably stressing over finals, trying to enjoy your "senior week," and maybe getting ready to embark on a new adventure in college. Diane Keng is on her third business and signing $100,000 investment deals.

item.title: [+529] Microsoft says 74 percent of work PCs still use Windows XP,
item.description: The latest Microsoft operating system may be selling seven copies a second, but it's no match for the behemoth Windows XP, still the most popular OS in the world despite recent nefarious attempts (we kid) to invoke spontaneous shutdowns, slow hard drives and trigger blue screens.

item.title: [+507] The Dismal Reality of Unemployment [cartoon]
item.description: Tom Toles highlights the harsh prospects facing the unemployed in our changing economy.

item.title: [+495] Expect to walk away from your home? Expect to get sued
item.description: Taking aim at homeowners who are able to pay their mortgage but decide it's not worth it, Fannie Mae plans to go after them in court and to limit their access to home loans for seven years.

item.title: [+493] Majority of Americans lack faith in Obama: poll - Yahoo! New
item.description: Nearly 60 percent of American voters say they lack faith in President Barack Obama, according to a public opinion poll published on Tuesday.

item.title: [+491] 14 Inventions You Could Have Easily Thought Of (PICS)
item.description: You ever see a new product and immediately think "I could have thought of that?" and then repeatedly kick yourself for the rest of the day for not being a gazillionaire? Yes yes, we've all been there. And we're right. We could have been gazillionaires. All of us. Yet for some reason we didn't patent our "pizza scissors".
